alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin, northwestern Fergus, southwestern Blaine and eastern Chouteau Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several thunderstorms across across portions of Judith Basin, Chouteau and Fergus counties with the strongest strong thunderstorm located 10 miles northeast of Denton, or 27 miles northeast of Stanford, moving east at 40 mph. Winds gusts to 50 mph, breif heavy rain, occasional lightning and small hail are likely with most of these storms, while hail up to one half inch is possible with the storm tracking across northern Fergus county. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stanford, Geraldine, Denton, Winifred, Danvers, Coffee Creek, Suffolk, Square Butte, Judith Landing, Hilger, Christina and Iliad. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
